title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-1.1 - Purpose
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-1.1 - Purpose

State Regulations

The purpose of this code is to protect the public health. Owners and operators of food service establishments are to operate their premises in such a way as to avoid imminent health hazards. Health hazards in operation, when called to their attention by the representative of the permit-issuing official, are to be corrected immediately. Deficiencies, other than imminent health hazards, such as poor sanitary practices, are to be corrected in accordance with a schedule approved by the permit-issuing official. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
14-1.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
